channel.title: general on Newsround
channel.description: Recent content in general on Newsround

item.title: Trump tariffs live updates: Trump announces tariffs on European countries until deal is reached for 'purchase of Greenland'; Danish PM says Europe 'will not be blackmailed' - Yahoo Finance
item.description: President Trump has said the acquisition of Greenland is crucial for the US but European allies, including Denmark and Greenland, remain staunchly opposed to…

item.title: Wildfires race across Chile, leaving 18 dead and forcing thousands to flee - AP News
item.description: Authorities in Chile say that wildfires raging across central and southern areas of the country have left at least 18 people dead. The flames have scorched thousands of acres of forest and destroyed scores of homes. The South American country is sweltering un…

item.title: Center left wins Portugal presidential election first round, setting up showdown with far right - politico.eu
item.description: António José Seguro will face far-right leader André Ventura in a runoff ballot Feb. 8.

item.title: Louisiana’s Letlow prepares Senate bid after Trump endorsement - Politico
item.description: Her entry would be the worst-case scenario for GOP Sen. Bill Cassidy.

item.title: Minneapolis Mayor Jacob Frey says federal agents are an occupying force - CBS News
item.description: Minneapolis Mayor Jacob Frey criticized the administration’s immigration operations, calling the surge of federal agents an “occupying force that has quite literally invaded our city.”

item.title: Trump urges lawmaker to challenge GOP senator who voted to convict him - The Washington Post
item.description: The president endorsed Rep. Julia Letlow of Louisiana, who hasn’t announced a Senate run. Sen. Bill Cassidy voted convict in the impeachment trial over the Jan. 6 riot.

item.title: Melting ice may raise Greenland’s value. Trump’s fight may be just the start. - The Washington Post
item.description: Trump has said he wants the territory because of its strategic location. Maps show how a melting Arctic is affecting geopolitics.

item.title: Peak travel: Viewing the U.S. from each state's highest point - CBS News
item.description: “Highpointers” are people with a quirky goal: summiting the highest point in each of the 50 states, from Mr. McKinley in Alaska (elevation: 20,310 feet above sea level), to Florida’s Britton Hill (elevation: 345 feet).

item.title: Carney mulling $1B membership to Trump’s ‘Board of Peace’ - Politico
item.description: The Canadian PM said the POTUS invite came “a few weeks ago.”

item.title: ICE jumps to center of midterm campaigns - Politico
item.description: None

item.title: CBS News poll finds more Americans say ICE being too tough; Republicans feel protesters have gone too far - CBS News
item.description: Looking overseas, there is wide opposition to the idea of taking Greenland by force.

item.title: Green Day to open 60th Super Bowl with anniversary ceremony celebrating generations of MVPs - AP News
item.description: The NFL has announced that Green Day will kick off the 60th Super Bowl with an opening ceremony at Levi’s Stadium in Santa Clara, California. The performance will celebrate six decades of the league’s championship game history. The band will help usher genera…

item.title: 1,500 soldiers on standby for possible Minnesota deployment, source says, as state mobilizes National Guard - CNN
item.description: The Pentagon has ordered about 1,500 active-duty soldiers to prepare for possible deployment to Minnesota, according to a Trump administration source, as state officials have also mobilized the National Guard.

item.title: Seahawks thump 49ers in playoff opener, advance to NFC Championship Game - The Seattle Times
item.description: In a game that felt over almost as soon as it started, the Seahawks thumped the 49ers 41-6 in their playoff opener and advance to the NFC Championship Game.

item.title: ‘SNL’ Mocks Trump’s Nobel Prize Envy, Colin Jost’s Unhinged Pete Hegseth Promises ‘USA is Going to F—‘ Countries Around the World - Variety
item.description: ‘SNL’ mocked President Trump’s egomania around the Nobel Peace Prize and Kristi Noem’s response to the ICE shooting in Minneapolis in its cold open.

item.title: Pennsylvania woman's final moments captured on home security video. Will it help prove she was murdered? - CBS News
item.description: Bruno Rocuba claims a freak accident while handling his gun caused the death of his wife, Melissa Rocuba. He was not arrested or charged with any crime. Years later, investigators uncover disturbing new evidence that challenges what really happened that night…

item.title: Gaza is our show: U.S. pushes its plan over Netanyahu's objections - Axios
item.description: “If he wants us to deal with Gaza, it will have to be our way.”

item.title: DHS seeking to deport two men who said fellow ICE detainee was killed - The Washington Post
item.description: The two men’s eyewitness accounts of the Jan. 3 death of Geraldo Lunas Campos at a Texas detention camp differ from the Department of Homeland Security’s account of the incident.

item.title: Scientists find an interstellar 'tunnel' that connects our solar system to other stars - Earth.com
item.description: Astronomers found an interstellar “tunnel” - a cosmic channel that connects our solar system to distant stars, according to a recent study.

item.title: March led by pardoned Jan. 6 rioter in Minneapolis ends in scuffle - The Washington Post
item.description: The right-wing provocateur known for incendiary rhetoric and his 10 or so supporters were outnumbered by a large crowd of counterprotesters in Minneapolis.

item.title: EU Set to Halt US Trade Deal Over Trump’s New Tariff Threat - Bloomberg.com
item.description: European Union lawmakers are poised to halt approval of the EU’s trade deal with the US over President Donald Trump’s vow to impose tariffs on countries that supported Greenland in the face of American threats.

item.title: Starmer brands Trump's plan to apply tariffs over Greenland 'completely wrong' - BBC
item.description: The US president says the UK, Denmark and other European countries will be charged a “10% tariff on any or all goods” exported to the US from 1 February.

item.title: ‘Heavy’ snow could impact parts of central Georgia, metro Atlanta mostly spared - AJC.com
item.description: The state’s best chance for snow comes overnight Saturday into Sunday afternoon along a diagonal line from Columbus to Macon to Warrenton, the National Weather Service says.

item.title: Norwegian Acting Legend Liv Ullmann Wades Into Donald Trump Nobel Peace Prize Gift: “He Will Lose It” – European Film Awards - Deadline
item.description: Norwegian Acting Legend Liv Ullmann Wades Into Donald Trump Nobel Peace Prize Gift: “He Will Lose It” – European Film Awards

item.title: Five die in Austrian avalanches, rescuers say - BBC
item.description: A number of people have died in the Alps over the past week, as heavy snowfall has hit the region.

item.title: Justice Dept. enters new territory with probe of Minnesota officials - The Washington Post
item.description: The agency is targeting critics during a moment of crisis in which protesters are clashing with federal agents on icy city streets.

item.title: Abigail Spanberger becomes Virginia’s 1st female governor in historic inauguration - Politico
item.description: Her swearing-in marks a new political chapter in the commonwealth, with Democrats pulling the levers of power in state government.

item.title: European Union and Mercosur bloc of South American nations sign landmark free trade agreement - AP News
item.description: The European Union and the Mercosur bloc of South American countries have formally signed a long-sought landmark free trade agreement. The deal inked on Saturday caps more than a quarter-century of torturous negotiations to strengthen commercial ties in the f…

item.title: Trump to POLITICO: ‘It’s time to look for new leadership in Iran’ - Politico
item.description: Trump, after being read a series of hostile X posts from Iran’s Supreme Leader, said the Ayatollah is guilty of “the complete destruction of his country.”

item.title: Five graphics that show Greenland’s importance to Trump - DW.com
item.description: Its entire population would fit in a large sports stadium but Greenland’s current presence on the geopolitical stage is huge. DW takes a look at the reasons it’s so coveted — from natural resources to climate change.

item.title: Uganda election result: Yoweri Museveni beats Bobi Wine to win a seventh term - BBC
item.description: President Yoweri Museveni wins a seventh term, as his main rival Bobi Wine decries “fake results”.

item.title: Here’s where Trump’s most jaw-dropping promises stand a year into his second term - AP News
item.description: President Donald Trump has made lots of promises during the first year of his second term in the White House. Some ideas have come to fruition. Others have faded away. Some are kicking around. These include a new Air Force One gifted by Qatar and the U.S. ann…

item.title: From ‘A+’ grade to ‘we can’t stand this much longer,’ Georgia voters take stock of Trump’s first year back in office - CNN
item.description: Franz Rowland has heard President Donald Trump endlessly brag about a roaring economy, but he’s seen few signs of it from his cotton farm here in southern Georgia.

item.title: How Ukrainians Are Protecting Their Homes Against Russia’s Winter Offensive - Kyiv Post
item.description: Kyiv faces up to 20 hours without electricity each day after relentless Russian strikes, yet residents are finding creative ways to cope with the blackout.

item.title: Trump administration rolls back $2 billion mental health, addiction grant cuts - NPR
item.description: Sweeping cuts to mental health and addiction programs worth more than $2 billion are being reversed. After a political backlash from Republicans and Democrats, the grant money will be restored.

item.title: Reports: Shooting involving federal law enforcement in north Minneapolis - kare11.com
item.description: A large crowd has formed in the Hawthorne neighborhood.

item.title: Iran briefly closes airspace as U.S. tensions rise, flights rerouted across region - CNBC
item.description: Iran temporarily closed most of its airspace late Wednesday, forcing airlines to reroute flights as tensions with the United States escalated.

item.title: Twenty one English councils ask for election delays - BBC
item.description: Nearly a third of eligible authorities have want to postpone local polls scheduled for May.

item.title: US and UK pulling some personnel from Qatar military base - BBC
item.description: US officials say it is a “precautionary measure” and comes as Donald Trump weighs up whether to take action against Iran.

item.title: In a win for Democrats, court allows California's redistricting plan to proceed - NPR
item.description: In November, California voters approved a new congressional map that could help Democrats win five more House seats and counter the Republican redistricting that President Trump has prompted in other states.

item.title: Embarrassing floor meltdown has House Republicans questioning their leaders - Politico
item.description: A group of pro-labor holdouts handed the GOP its latest setback and underscored the tough path for party-line legislation this year.

item.title: US will suspend immigrant visa processing from 75 countries over public assistance concerns - AP News
item.description: The State Department says it will suspend the processing of immigrant visas for citizens of 75 countries whose nationals are deemed likely to require public assistance while living in the United States. The department said Wednesday it had instructed consular…

item.title: Congressional Bill S. 222 Signed into Law - The White House (.gov)
item.description: On Wednesday, January 14, 2026, the President signed into law: S. 222, the “Whole Milk for Healthy Kids Act of 2025,” which modifies the requirements for

item.title: Ryan Hurst Cast As Kratos In Prime Video’s ‘God of War’ - Deadline
item.description: Ryan Hurst has been cast in the series lead role of Kratos In Prime Video’s ‘God of War.’

item.title: Red Sox To Sign Ranger Suárez - MLB Trade Rumors
item.description: The Red Sox missed on Bregman but quickly pivot to adding more pitching.

item.title: Starlink reportedly made free in Iran - but protesters are taking huge risks by using it - BBC
item.description: The satellite technology has become a vital communications lifeline after the government shut down the internet last week.
